name: HelloWorld
description: This is the Hello World integration for getting started.
author: Cortex XSOAR

integration.name: HelloWorld (Community Contribution)
integration.description: This is the Hello World integration for getting started.

commands.name: helloworld-say-hello
commands.description: Hello command - prints hello to anyone.

commands.name: helloworld-get-alert
commands.description: Retrieve alert extra data by ID.

commands.name: helloworld-update-alert-status
commands.description: Update the status for an alert.

commands.name: helloworld-scan-status
commands.description: Retrieve scan status for one or more scan IDs.

commands.name: helloworld-scan-results
commands.description: Retrieve scan status in Context or as a File (default) for a Scan.

playbook.name: Handle Hello World Alert
playbook.description: This is a playbook which will handle the alerts coming from the Hello World service

playbook.name: HelloWorld Scan
playbook.description:
This Playbook simulates a vulnerability scan using the "HelloWorld" sample integration. It's used to demonstrate how to use the GenericPolling mechanism to run jobs that take several seconds or minutes to complete. It is designed to be used as a subplaybook, but you can also use it as a standalone playbook, by providing the ${Endpoint.Hostname} input in the Context.

Other inputs include the report output format (JSON context or File attached), and the Interval/Timeouts to use for polling the scan status until it's complete.

classifier.name: Hello World - Incoming Mapper
classifier.description: Maps incoming Hello World alert fields.
